PageTitle: mpls te backup hot-standby overlap-path (Tunnel interface view)
FuncDef:
The mpls te backup hot-standby overlap-path command enables path overlapping function.
The undo mpls te backup hot-standby overlap-path command disables path overlapping function.
By default, the hot-standby path cannot coincide with the path of the primary LSP.
CLIs: undo mpls te backup hot-standby overlap-path
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The path overlapping function can be configured for hot-standby CR-LSPs when there are limited network resources. This function allows a hot-standby CR-LSP to use some links of a primary CR-LSP and ensures that the hot-standby CR-LSP is established. The hot-standby and primary CR-LSPs cannot fully overlap.
Prerequisites
An MPLS TE tunnel has been created using the interface tunnel command.
MPLS TE has been configured as the protocol of the tunnel using the tunnel-protocol command.
